summary.title: JSS Special Issue on “Intelligent DevOps for Performance, Sustainability, and Reliability”

description.overview: This special issue seeks to explore the balance between the advantages of DevOps in accelerating software delivery and the challenges it poses to quality assurance, particularly regarding performance, sustainability, and reliability.
topics: Observability and monitoring in DevOps pipelines
Application of AIOps techniques for quality assurance
Automated anomaly detection and incident prediction
Data-driven feedback loops for continuous improvement
Intelligent test automation and AI-driven defect prediction
Integration of AI into CI/CD pipelines
Infrastructure as code with intelligent performance tuning
AI methods to enhance software quality
Sustainability techniques such as energy-efficient builds
Predictive modeling for capacity planning and reliability
Use of large language models in DevOps automation
Software architecture modeling informed by operational data
Comparative evaluations and empirical studies in quality assurance

submission_instructions.preparation: Manuscripts must follow the Guide for Authors.

editors.name: Weiyi Shang
editors.institution: University of Waterloo, Waterloo Ontario, Canada
